page.title: 01An Introduction to Aldridge
page.content: {Aldridge}today is a thriving town of almost 20,000 people. It's centre is dominated by a new shopping precinct, including an indoor market, where all the necessities of life can be bought. Alongside this lies{The Croft}- our village green, and the Parish Church of{St. Mary's.}The area has several factory estates containing light engineering works, small businesses and warehousing facilities. Most housing is in the form of modern estates, rented and owner_occupied. The area has five infant and primary schools, including one C of E and one R.C. It also has two Comprehensive schools one an R.C. Large areas around the village of{Aldridge}are still used for agriculture and recreation but the last of the farmland to the north is threatened by a proposed motorway.
